text: Grevillea xiphoidea is a shrub of the genus Grevillea native to an area in the Wheatbelt region of Western Australia. The erect shrub typically grows to a height of and has glaucous branchlets. It has dissected tripartite leaves that are deeply divided to midvein. The leaves have a blade that is . It blooms between June to September and produces an axillary or terminal raceme regular inflorescence with white or cream flowers with white or cream styles. Later it forms smooth, oblong or ellipsoidal, glabrous fruit that are long. ==See also== * List of Grevillea species ==References== xiphoidea Category:Proteales of Australia Category:Eudicots of Western Australia
title: Grevillea xiphoidea
